sub_title: Remaker, senior lecturer, and education researcher at Industrial Design Engineering, TU Delft
summary:
In my job as a university lecturer I teach the young generation about our precious world, and how to design for a better future. My research focusses on the most inner circles of the circular economy, (re)designing product architectures for improved repairability and refurbishability.

As an educated aeronautical (Msc) and industrial design engineer (Msc) I find it interesting to apply the quantitative ways of design in designing mass-produced products. In short I like to automate design processes by means of mathematical modeling.

Specialties: Life Cycle Assessment, Design for Circular Economy, Repair and Repairability, Life Cycle Thinking and Design,  quantitative conceptual design.

treasury_media.title: 3D Printing for Repair Guide
treasury_media.description: This guide takes the reader through the 3D Printing for Repair (3DP4R) process. It consists of guidelines and tools to create a 3D printable version of spare parts needed for a product repair.

projects.title: ShaRepair - 3D printing for repair
projects.description:
This project aims to decrease waste from consumer products by scaling up citizen repair initiatives through the use of digital tools. These tools collect repair solutions and make them easily accessible to everyday people. They will target both ordinary people at home and skilled repairers in repair cafés. 

The role of TU Delft’s Sustainable Design Engineering team is primarily to enable 3D printing for repair.  First, we identify current opportunities and obstacles, then we develop digital tools and training to assist ordinary people in using 3D printing to repair their broken household products. This will include an open-source database of 3D part designs for printing replacement parts, as well as tutorials for people to learn the skills needed. It will include how to 3D model replacement parts, print them, determine quality, and perhaps redesign replacement parts to upgrade their products or compensate for the lower mechanical performance of 3D printing materials compared to the product’s original materials. 

The objective is to decrease Waste Electronical and Electronic Equipment (WEEE) by 10% in pilot repair cafés, for a total of 15 tonnes of waste avoided per year. Additionally, SHAREPAIR aims to avoid 0.5 tonnes of WEEE per 1,000 inhabitants in the pilot cities. Ultimately, this would result in a total of 100 tonnes of waste avoided per year.

Jeremy Faludi is an expert on 3D printing for sustainability and Bas Flipsen loves to fix stuff.

projects.title: Regenerative Braking, is it worth it?
projects.description:
Within the master course module of Sustainable Design Engineering I have setup a regenerative braking workshop and let students measure their braking behavior. Based on this braking behavior we have designed and calculated the feasibility of a Kinetic Energy Recovery System (KERS) system for bicycles.

Problem: Cycling in urban areas is a constant change between accelerating, keeping up to speed and braking. Acceleration is always at the cost of the riders’ ability to deliver power. Braking on the other hand dissipates your carefully accumulated forward momentum into wasted heat. 

Regenerative Braking Systems (RBS) could be an answer to this unnecessary wasting of energy. They have been developed before, using either mechanical or electronic accumulators. These designs are mostly based on maximum energy recovery and are thus bulky and mostly oversized. The question is if its worth to add an extra intermediate accumulator system to an average bicycle? 

For this we ?defined “worth it” as “the ability to recover the same amount of energy as its’ production embodied energy” within the economic lifespan of the bicycle”, in other words, the Energy PayBack Time. 

Before we can answer the main research question we have to know: How often does a bicyclist brake, and how much energy can be harvested during these braking-instances? To answer these questions we have measured and evaluated the speed and braking pro?les of 180 bicycle trips,
which account together to more than 600km.

Concluding from this exercise, more than 75% of all brake instances harvest only small amounts of energy, as much as 600J. This amount equals to only 40% of the energy wasted when braking to a
full stop (1500J). Knowing this we have designed an optimized RBS and calculate the EPBT for different design variants.

contributors.headline: Remaker, senior lecturer, and education researcher at Industrial Design Engineering, TU Delft

projects.title: Snuffelneus, a low-cost wearable outdoor air quality device
projects.description:
Vanaf september 2013 zijn studenten van de opleidingen Industrieel Product Ontwerpen, Elektrotechniek en Technische Informatica vanuit de Hogeschool Rotterdam bezig met het project “Snuffelneus”. Een apparaat dat de luchtkwaliteit gaat meten op een dynamische en mobiele manier. Het concept en de werking van de Snuffelneus is nu een aantal maanden verder al bijna werkelijkheid geworden.

De Snuffelneus is een apparaat met sensoren geïntegreerd in een fietslampje. Het apparaat meet de luchtkwaliteit door het meten van NO2 (stikstofdioxide), de temperatuur en luchtvochtigheid. Met deze combinatie kunnen we de luchtkwaliteit bepalen. wpid-featuredImage.png

Nadat de Snuffelneus de luchtkwaliteit heeft bepaald, communiceert de neus via bluetooth met de gebruiker zijn smartphone. De neus communiceert met een van te voren ingestelde interval de gemeten informatie met de applicatie. Een meting die bestaat uit een bepaalde waarde (luchtkwaliteit), op een bepaald gebied, op een bepaalde tijd. Deze informatie wordt door de applicatie gebruikt om een kaartoverzicht te geven van de huidige positie van de gebruiker en zijn of haar metingen en die van andere neuzen in de stad. Hierdoor is in één oogopslag te zien waar de luchtkwaliteit t.o.v. andere gebieden beter of slechter is.

Met deze informatie willen wij de gebruiker van de Snuffelneus bewust laten worden van de luchtkwaliteit waar hij of zij zich in bevindt. Tegelijkertijd kan hiermee een inventarisatie van de luchtkwaliteit in Rotterdam worden gemaakt, om hiermee de Gemeente Rotterdam en eventuele andere overheidsinstanties zo op de hoogte te houden over de voortgang in het reduceren van de luchtvervuiling in de stad gezien dit een dynamisch en realtime beeld is.

projects.title: Low-cost Arduino-based datalogger
projects.description: Together with DEMO Delft and Grassroots we have developed a low-cost datalogger based on the open-source Arduino Nano. The development of this project will be published and we are open for co-development of the small datalogger (20 x 40 x 17mm3), which consists of a Arduino Nano platform, a micro-SD logger system with timer and charging possibilities for the li-ion battery, and a small prototype board which can be used to solder the sensors on.

authors.headline: Remaker, senior lecturer, and education researcher at Industrial Design Engineering, TU Delft
Remaker, senior lecturer, and education researcher at Industrial Design Engineering, TU Delft

profile_positions.description:
Together with the teams of Design For Sustainability and Circular Product Design we are teaching our students about life-cycle assessment and introduce them to the field of circular product design.

My research focusses on repairability and the ease-of-disassembly of consumer (electronic) products. We are developing tools for industrial and product-architecture designers to evaluate and improve their product portfolio and make products circular ready.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Within the group of Design for Sustainability I focus on Alternative energy systems for portable electronics. Part of this work involved parametric design, drive-train design and optimization of electronic products on energy consumption.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor - Design for Sustainability

profile_positions.description:
As an Assistant Professor I am course coordinator for the second year dynamics course at the faculty of Industrial Design Engineering. 

Besides my other teaching in the bachelor and master of IDE I am responsible for research in the field of Lightweight Vehicle Design, where I try to model the power-characteristics of the rider in the bike-rider system.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor - Product Engineering

profile_positions.description:
In dit comenius project willen we onze studenten middels “Theory U” een praktische basis geven in omgaan met de individuele verschillen in de context van internationale designteams en innovatieve ontwerpprojecten. We ontwikkelen hiervoor onderwijsmaterialen en een coachingstraject die studenten op dit onderwerp effectief begeleidt. De effectiviteit van deze aanpak wordt door gemeten door drie meetinstrumenten: vooraf middels peer feedback, tijdens het project middels de Performance Dashboard, en achteraf middels individuele- en groepsreflecties.

We zien in de masteropleiding van Industrieel Ontwerpen (IO) een groeiende diversiteit in studenten. Afgelopen jaren is het aantal internationale studenten in de opleiding gegroeid tot meer dan 30%. We zien ook steeds vaker studenten met een andere vooropleiding dan onze eigen IO bachelor opleiding. In het vak Advanced Embodiment Design (AED) werken onze studenten voor 1 semester (21 EC) samen in 1 team aan een ontwerpproject. Wekelijks worden de studententeams begeleidt door docenten. Zij coachen naast inhoudelijk voornamelijk op een gezonde groepsdynamica. 

Afgelopen jaren merkten we dat de multiculturele achtergrond, diverse achtergrondopleidingen en verschillen in kennisniveaus tot complicaties binnen de verschillende teams kunnen leiden. Voorbeelden zijn communicatieverwarring, frustratie en soms persoonlijke aanvaringen. Er is een groeiende kloof tussen de teamleden op cognitieve en sociaal emotionele aspecten en op hun vermogen hier opbouwend mee om te gaan. We kunnen alle studenten betere groeikansen bieden als ontwerper zodra ze deze diversiteiten herkennen, de expertise en skills van andere masterstudenten leren te waarderen, en deze als kans te zien voor eigen ontwikkeling en die van het team.
profile_positions.title: Comenius Teaching Fellowship

profile_positions.description: At iFixit I develop the new objective Reparability Score, which indicates how reparable a product is. In a vibrating environment I work together with my colleagues at iFixit EU to define reparability, and make it measurable.
profile_positions.title: Senior researcher

profile_positions.description: Within a team of excellent professional people we made the TeachingLab and Teaching Academy more visible to our educating staff at the TU Delft. We organized amongst other Teacher Talk Tuesdays, where teachers meet up with each other, and Meet and Eat lunch presentations, where excellent TU educators showed their finding in improving their own teaching and student learning.
profile_positions.title: Academic Director ad. int.

profile_positions.description: As an Education Fellow I focussed my research in education on Sustainable Teaching, a combination of applying effective learning strategies in an efficient way. During this period I have given several presentations and workshops around the TU Delft Campus to help teachers in improving their educational duties and come to a balance between between work and life.
profile_positions.title: Education Fellow

profile_positions.description: Together with my researchers and teachers we conduct studies concerning Sustainable Product Development (Duurzame Product Ontwikkeling). The focus is on Circular Plastics, giving second life to industrial plastics, and Ecotronics, using electronics to improve sustainable wellbeing. Volg onze ontwikkelingen op www.groenedingendoen.nl
profile_positions.title: Research Professor Sustainable Product Development

profile_positions.description: De beste sokken van Falke, Burlington en Effio, direct bij u in de brievenbus.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the group of Sustainable innovation design, where I did projects in the field of:
- alternative energy systems: human power, PV cells and fuel cells
- sustainable mobility:Mitka project and the NIKE power generating spinning bike
- design of sustainable kitchen appliances: kitchen stove, hot-water boiler
- Optimization for energy-efficiency: Energy analysis visualization for the goal of redesign or rethink!
profile_positions.title: Projectleader - Sustainable Product Innovation
